Grant Name: House of Europe International Cooperation Grants (Autumn 2025 Call)
Eligibility Criteria: Public non-profit organizations in the culture and creative industries registered in Ukraine or an EU country. Applicants should demonstrate relevant experience and a project portfolio. Collaboration between Ukrainian and EU/UK organizations is required.
Focus Areas: Cultural exchanges and collaborative projects between Ukrainian and EU/UK organizations. This can include music festivals, virtual exhibitions, book fairs, digital residencies, theatrical plays, and conferences. Priority is given to impactful and timely initiatives, projects involving digital technologies, and those engaging Ukrainian audiences.
Grant Amount: Up to €50,000. Covers staff costs, service costs (artistic honorariums, translation, design, production), administration costs (rent, equipment, consumables), and travel costs. Does not cover ongoing organizational costs or purchase/renovation of equipment.
Application Deadline: Autumn 2025. Specific dates are announced on the House of Europe website and newsletter. The Spring 2025 call deadline has likely passed.

Focus Areas: Молодь exchanges, volunteering, Молодь Демократія projects, partnerships

Grant Name: British Council - Connections Through Culture Grants 2025
Country/Region: United Kingdom and selected countries including Ukraine.
Eligibility Criteria: Artists, creative practitioners, arts and cultural organisations, hubs, networks, and collectives. Individual applicants should be nationals living inside one of the listed participating countries (including Ukraine) or UK individuals living/working in the UK. Organization applicants should be registered in the UK or one of the listed participating countries. Collaboration between UK and partner country entities is central.
Focus Areas: Collaborative artistic and cultural projects (digital, face-to-face, and/or hybrid formats). Art forms include: Architecture, design & fashion (including craft); Creative technology (incl. games, XR, immersive tech); Film; Literature; Music; Theatre and dance; Visual arts. Cross-art form projects and projects with themes relevant to the creative economy, diversity, and inclusion, or climate action are welcomed. For Ukraine, specific attention to risk management, security, and shelter access for in-person events is required.
Grant Amount: Up to GBP 10,000 for collaborative projects between the UK and Ukraine. (Equivalent to approx. €11,800 as of early June 2025).
Duration: Projects are expected to start from October 2025. Duration is project-based.

Funding Organization: United Nations Industrial Development Organization (UNIDO) and Global Environment Facility (GEF). Implemented in Ukraine by Greencubator (Ukrainian NGO).
Country/Region: Ukraine (part of a global program in 17 countries).
Eligibility Criteria: Clean technology startups and micro-, small, and medium-sized enterprises (MSMEs) in Ukraine. Requires a competent, established team, at least one Ukrainian co-founder, a finished product with first customers, willingness to actively participate in accelerator sessions, and basic English proficiency (B2 or higher).
Focus Areas: Innovations in energy efficiency, renewable energy sources, waste recycling/beneficiation, water efficiency/conservation, green transportation, environmentally friendly/green buildings, advanced materials & chemicals. The program aims to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, improve energy efficiency, develop a circular economy, and adapt society to climate change.
Grant Amount: Grant support of up to $USD 20,000 for the most successful teams participating in the acceleration program. The program also provides acceleration services, mentoring, and networking.
Application Deadline: June 23, 2025 (23:59 CEST) for the GCIP Ukraine 2025 acceleration program..6
Duration: The acceleration program lasts for 14 weeks (3 months of training).
Website Link: GCIP Ukraine Country Page (for application) and Greencubator GCIP Page (for program details).

Grant Name: IOM Hungary - Call for Implementing Partners (Assistance to Refugees from Ukraine)
Country/Region: Hungary (Projects targeting refugees from Ukraine in Hungary).
Eligibility Criteria: Governmental agencies, government-owned/controlled corporations, IGOs, IOs, NGOs, non-profit agencies (including nonprofit KFT, nonprofit RT), ICSOs, or civil society organizations. Must have technical expertise, operational capacity, and local presence.
Focus Areas: Providing life-saving assistance to refugees from Ukraine in Hungary. Specific areas/activities to be detailed in proposals, aligning with IOM Hungary's strategic objectives (humanitarian assistance, access to essential services, specialized protection). Emphasis on shelter, basic non-food items, and shelter improvements.
Grant Amount: Project proposals should include a budget within the range of 10,000,000 to 40,000,000 Hungarian Forints (HUF) (Approx. €25,000 - €100,000).
Duration: Activities must be completed on or before December 31, 2025.
Website Link: IOM Hungary News - Call for Implementing Partners

Eligibility Criteria: Організації, що працюють у сферах ядерної безпеки, реформи правосуддя, громадянського суспільства та медіа в Україні
Focus Areas: Ядерна безпека, реформа правосуддя, громадянське суспільство, незалежність медіа
Grant Amount: Значні гранти від 100 000 доларів США та вище

Eligibility Criteria: Election та human rights groups
Focus Areas: Election observation, human rights, rule з law, conflict resolution

Focus Areas: Права людини, соціальна справедливість, демократія, зміцнення громадянського суспільства
Grant Amount: Різні суми залежно від проєкту та потреб

Grant Name: KSE Foundation - "Talents for Ukraine" Grant Program
Eligibility Criteria: Primarily individuals ("dreamers and innovators whose ideas are changing the lives of others"). Winners include scientists, educators, developers, innovators, cultural figures, volunteers, medical professionals, human rights advocates, environmental activists. While individual-focused, some winners are founders/leaders of NGOs or projects with societal impact. 60% of assistance supports STEM talents, 40% for social, cultural, or other fields.
Focus Areas: Personal development and pursuit of projects in diverse fields: STEM (science, technology, engineering, mathematics), culture, education, innovation, volunteering, medical aid, human rights, environmental activism.
Grant Amount: Individual grants, e.g., one winner received $USD 5,000 for an internship. Overall program supports "talented individuals." Specific maximums not detailed for all categories.

Eligibility Criteria: Registered civil society organizations with proven track record and financial management capacity. Must have legal registration status. Demonstrated financial management capacity. Clear project proposal aligned with grant objectives. Commitment to reporting and accountability.
Focus Areas: French language, cultural diversity, Демократія, peace

Grant Name: EU House of Europe Travel Grants
Eligibility Criteria: Ukrainian cultural operators до CSOs
Focus Areas: International mobility до networking for Культура до Громадянське суспільство professionals

Grant Name: Open Society Foundations - Ukraine Democracy Fund / General Grantmaking
Funding Organization: Open Society Foundations (OSF) (operates in Ukraine via International Renaissance Foundation (IRF))
Eligibility Criteria: Primarily organizations (movements, coalitions, networks, CSOs). OSF awards grants to entities whose values and work align with OSF's mission. The vast majority of grants are awarded to organizations OSF approaches directly, but some open opportunities are occasionally listed. IRF is the national foundation in Ukraine.
Focus Areas: Promoting democratic practice, advancing rights and human dignity, equitable governance. Specific to Ukraine: supporting civil society in the context of war, accountable government decision-making, advocacy for people affected by the invasion, veteran reintegration, anti-corruption, education reform, legal aid.
Grant Amount: Varies greatly. OSF has committed an initial $USD 25 million to the Ukraine Democracy Fund (matched by other funders, total $USD 50M). Total OSF grants in Ukraine since 1990 exceed $USD 240M. Individual grant amounts are not specified for open calls.
Application Deadline: Most grants are by invitation. For open calls, deadlines are specified if available. As of June 7, 2025, no specific open calls for Ukrainian CSOs were explicitly detailed in the provided general OSF funding pages. Monitoring IRF's website (irf.ua) and OSF's grant pages is recommended.

Eligibility Criteria: Environmental до Права людини CSOs
Focus Areas: Green transformation, Демократія, Гендерна рівність, Права людини

Focus Areas: Соціальна справедливість, демократія, спадщина, розвиток філантропії

Eligibility Criteria: Cultural та educational organizations
Focus Areas: Arts та culture, English language, Освіта, civil society skills

Eligibility Criteria: Соціальний inclusion organizations
Focus Areas: Employment, Соціальний inclusion, Освіта, poverty reduction

Grant Name: National Endowment for Democracy (NED) Regular Grants
Country/Region: International, including Ukraine. NED funds programs in over 100 countries.
Eligibility Criteria: Non-governmental organizations (e.g., civic organizations, associations, independent media). NED does not make grants to individuals, governmental bodies, or state-supported institutions like public universities. All projects must align with NED's Statement of Principles and Objectives.
Focus Areas: Promoting and defending human rights and the rule of law; supporting freedom of information and independent media; strengthening democratic ideas and values; promoting accountability and transparency; strengthening civil society organizations; strengthening democratic political processes and institutions; promoting civic education; supporting democratic conflict resolution; promoting freedom of association; strengthening a broad-based market economy.
Grant Amount: Not specified in the general call; grant amounts vary considerably depending on the project's size and scope. (Historically, average NED grants globally are around $USD 50,000, but this is a general figure not specific to Ukraine in the provided information).
Application Deadline: NED has quarterly proposal submission deadlines. The deadlines listed for the 2024-2025 cycle were September 3, 2024, January 28, 2025, and May 20, 2025. Proposals submitted after a deadline are considered at the following Board Meeting. The next likely deadline post-May 2025 would be approximately September 2025, pending NED's official schedule update.
Duration: Project-based, typically 12 months, but can vary.

Grant Name: European Endowment for Democracy (EED) – Rapid Response Grants for Democracy Initiatives
Funding Organization: European Endowment for Democracy (EED), an EU-funded independent fund based in Brussels
Country/Region: Eastern Europe, Middle East & North Africa, and other regions in democratic transition (Ukraine is a priority country)
Eligibility Criteria: Flexible – EED supports civil society organizations, social movements, independent media, youth groups, and even individual activists
Focus Areas: Promotion of democracy and pluralism – e
Application Deadline: None (Rolling basis) – Applications are accepted at any time; EED does not issue specific calls or deadlines
Duration: Flexible – Determined by project needs (typically up to about 12 months; no strict maximum stated)

Grant Name: Програма екстреної допомоги Репортерів без кордонів
Funding Organization: Reporters Sans Frontières (RSF) / Репортери без кордонів

Focus Areas: Свобода преси, безпека журналістів, цифрова безпека, екстрена допомога переміщеним журналістам
Grant Amount: 500 - 10 000 євро для екстреної допомоги; більші суми для організаційної підтримки
Duration: Екстрена допомога: негайна; Проєктна підтримка: до 1 року

Grant Name: Фонд термінових дій за права жінок
Funding Organization: Urgent Action Fund for Women's Human Rights
Country/Region: Глобальний (Близький Схід, Європа, Балкани, Кавказ, Туреччина, Центральна Азія, Канада, США)
Eligibility Criteria: Правозахисниці та їхні організації, що стикаються з терміновими ризиками або можливостями
Focus Areas: Феміністичні рухи, права жінок, гендерна рівність, несподівані ризики та можливості
Grant Amount: До 8 000 доларів США для швидкого реагування; до 50 000 доларів США для довгострокової підтримки
Duration: Швидке реагування: 1-6 місяців; Довгострокова підтримка: до 2 років

Eligibility Criteria: Організації, що працюють у сферах освіти, суспільства, віри, клімату та гуманітарної допомоги
Focus Areas: Освіта, суспільство, віра, клімат, гуманітарна допомога
Grant Amount: Різні суми залежно від програми та регіону

Eligibility Criteria: Медіа-організації, журналісти, організації громадянського суспільства, що працюють над свободою слова
Focus Areas: Свобода вираження поглядів, реформа медіа-законодавства, цифрові права, безпека

Eligibility Criteria: Women's rights organizations, feminist groups, initiatives supporting women and girls in Ukraine
Focus Areas: Women's rights, gender equality, prevention of gender-based violence, women's political participation, economic empowerment of women

Eligibility Criteria: Local CSOs до community organizations
Focus Areas: Humanitarian aid, resilience building, social cohesion, clean energy transition

Grant Name: “Culture Helps” Project Grants for Integration through Culture (Insha Osvita & Zusa, co
Funding Organization: funded by the European Union – Ukraine & Germany/EU) – Eligibility: Non-profit organizations or independent initiatives based in Ukraine or in EU Creative Europe countries, working on integrating displaced Ukrainians through cultural activities . Focus areas: Social inclusion & mental health support for internally displaced persons (especially families/children) via cultural projects (workshops, art therapy, educational events, etc.)  . Grant amount: €2,000–€3,750 per grant (EU contribution) requiring 25% co-funding to reach up to €5,000 total project budget . Application deadline: Jan 21, 2025 (fourth & final call of program)  – Closed. Duration: ~1–2 months of activities (e.g. Feb–Mar 2025 for final round) . Website: [Insha Osvita – Culture Helps Call (4th round)] . Contact/Application: Online form via Typeform; applications accepted in English or Ukrainian . Contact email: culture_helps@insha-osvita.org . Application language: English or Ukrainian (either language accepted, no preference) . Co-funding: Yes – at least 25% of project costs (in cash or in-kind) . Recurrence: Program concluded (4 calls were planned 2023–2025) . Last verified: June 8, 2025  .

Eligibility Criteria: Правозахисні організації, юридичні клініки, адвокатські об'єднання
Focus Areas: Правосуддя, права людини, боротьба з корупцією, верховенство права

Grant Name: HOLD ON: SetUp Edition Grant Wave Program (via Public Space / FundsforNGOs)

Грант з прав людини Ради Європи

Grant Amount: Стипендія та покриття витрат на проживання

Funding Organization: Government of Ukraine (via State Employment Center and Ministry of Economy)
Eligibility Criteria: Individuals planning to register as Private Entrepreneurs (FOP), existing FOPs, and legal entities. Ineligible if located/operating in temporarily occupied territories, operating in Russia, under sanctions, bankrupt, prosecuted for corruption, have tax arrears, or involved in specific excluded activities (weapons, alcohol, tobacco, currency exchange, financial institutions). For the "Vlasna Sprava for Youth" sub-component, entrepreneurs up to 25 years old can receive up to UAH 150,000; job creation is not mandatory, but FOP registration is.
Focus Areas: Starting or developing a business. Funds can be used for purchasing equipment, raw materials, rent (max 25% of grant), equipment rental, marketing/advertising, franchising.
Grant Amount: Up to UAH 250,000 (approx. €5,700). For businesses in Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia, Mykolaiv, Sumy, Kharkiv, Kherson, and Chernihiv regions, assistance can be up to UAH 500,000 (approx. €11,400). Grant for youth (up to 25 years) is up to UAH 150,000 (approx. €3,400).
Application Deadline: Rolling application periods. The current period noted in one source was ending June 8, 2025. Subsequent stages and deadlines are published on the Diia portal.
Duration: Obligation to conduct business activities for at least 3 years and pay taxes. Job creation requirements depend on grant size (e.g., 1 job for UAH 150k, 2 jobs for UAH 250k).

Eligibility Criteria: Організації та підприємства з інноваційними рішеннями для подолання бідності та покращення життя людей у країнах з низьким та середнім рівнем доходу; повинні мати доказову базу впливу
Focus Areas: Подолання бідності, соціальні інновації, рішення на основі доказів
Grant Amount: 50 000 - 15 мільйонів доларів США залежно від стадії інновації
Duration: Різна, залежно від проєкту (від пілотних до масштабних проєктів)

Application Deadline: Rolling applications - contact ADA for specific deadlines

Eligibility Criteria: Ukrainian CSOs до municipalities
Focus Areas: Urban Розвиток, energy transition, Врядування, Громадянське суспільство Підтримка

Eligibility Criteria: Ukrainian nonprofits providing humanitarian aid, medical assistance, or emergency relief services

Grant Name: German Marshall Fund (GMF) “Ukraine: Relief, Resilience, Recovery” Program – Rapid Response Grants
Funding Organization: German Marshall Fund of the United States (GMF) – Ukraine: Relief, Resilience, Recovery (U3R) grant program (supported by international donors)
Country/Region: Ukraine (projects must be implemented by organizations based in Ukraine)
Eligibility Criteria: Civil society organizations, charitable foundations, independent media outlets, and civil society activists (e
Focus Areas: Resilience and emergency support for Ukrainian civil society
Grant Amount: Grants up to $25,000 USD per project
Duration: Projects should be concluded by 31 May 2026 (all activities must end by May 2026 under the current program)
Website Link: GMF – Ukraine: Relief, Resilience, Recovery program call

Grant Name: German Marshall Fund (GMF) Ukraine: Relief, Resilience, Recovery (U3R) Program
Funding Organization: German Marshall Fund of the United States (GMF)
Eligibility Criteria: Civil society organizations (CSOs) and independent media legally registered in Ukraine. The involvement of additional local partners is encouraged. Proposals cannot cover costs related to food, construction/renovations, or clothing. Salary compensation for team members should not exceed 40% of the total budget.
Application Deadline: Rolling. Proposals are reviewed by a committee that convenes every 6 to 8 weeks. Project activities must be completed by the end of May 2026.
Duration: All project activities must be completed by the end of May 2026.

Funding Organization: Association for Women's Rights in Development (AWID)
Eligibility Criteria: Феміністичні організації, мережі та рухи по всьому світу
Focus Areas: Ресурсне забезпечення феміністичних рухів, побудова феміністичної економіки, просування універсальних прав і справедливості

Eligibility Criteria: Безпека та law enforcement CSOs
Focus Areas: Border management, crime prevention, counter-terrorism, crisis management

Focus Areas: EU integration, Антикорупція, Права людини, social services, veterans Підтримка

Grant Name: EU Civil Society Organisations Call (via EU Funding & Tenders Portal)
Eligibility Criteria: Typically, civil society organizations registered in Ukraine. Specific eligibility criteria vary significantly depending on the individual call for proposals published on the EU Funding & Tenders Portal.
Focus Areas: A broad range of areas including gender leadership and conflict, human rights, democratic development, governance, accountability for war crimes, access to information, strengthening democratic processes, social cohesion, and sustainable development. Specific calls will detail thematic priorities.
Grant Amount: A €14 million call for CSOs was announced to open in May 2025, with €5 million of this specifically focused on gender leadership and conflict. An additional €13 million support package for direct awards to civil society projects was also being fast-tracked. Individual grant amounts under these umbrella announcements will vary per specific call on the portal.
Application Deadline: Varies by specific calls for proposals within the EU Funding & Tenders Portal. The overarching €14M initiative was launched in May 2025. Continuous monitoring of the portal is required for individual opportunity deadlines.

Grant Name: World Bank Recovery and Reconstruction Programs
Eligibility Criteria: Government agencies, implementing partners, CSOs involved in reconstruction monitoring and community engagement
Focus Areas: Infrastructure reconstruction, economic recovery, social services restoration, transparency in reconstruction, community participation in recovery planning

Eligibility Criteria: Медіа та civil society groups
Focus Areas: Медіа literacy, journalism excellence, Медіа sustainability, partnerships

Eligibility Criteria: Ukrainian think tanks до Громадянське суспільство organizations
Focus Areas: Political Освіта, Демократія promotion, Верховенство права, European integration

Eligibility Criteria: Cultural organizations
Focus Areas: German language, cultural exchange, arts, civil society dialogue
